OlÃ¡, JoÃ£o Marco. Esperamos que esteja bem!

content.text:
I can see you have a tech screening interview scheduled with Grupo QuintoAndar tomorrow (Sep 18, 2025) at 5:00 PM GMT-3 for a Staff Software Engineer position. The interviewer will be Luciano Holanda Gomes.

Would you like me to help you prepare for this interview in any specific way? I could:

1. Research QuintoAndar's tech stack and engineering practices
2. Help prepare technical topics relevant to Staff Software Engineer roles
3. Review common staff-level interview questions
4. Help organize your experience and achievements for discussion

What would be most helpful for your preparation?

1â†’---

     3â†’argument-hint: Raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin
     4â†’allowed-tools: Task, Read, TodoWrite, Write, LS, Grep, Glob, Edit
     5â†’---
     6â†’
     7â†’## Context
     8â†’
     9â†’Arguments: $ARGUMENTS
    10â†’Arguments is a raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin
    11â†’
    12â†’## Task
    13â†’
    14â†’Your task is to create 2 files:
    15â†’
    16â†’* A new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.
    17â†’* A new input file in the @job-hunting/input directory.
    18â†’
    19â†’### Steps
    20â†’
    21â†’1. Parse the arguments to extract the desired information
    22â†’2. analyze the arguments to determine the best template to use
    23â†’3. analyze the arguments to extract non-obvious information, like the datetime of the message and company name
    24â†’4. Create the history file
    25â†’5. Create the input file
    26â†’
    27â†’### Arguments Parsing
    28â†’
    29â†’You should parse the arguments to extract the following information:
    30â†’
    31â†’* The company name, either from the person's title or from the message body
    32â†’* The recruiting company name (for contract positions), either from the person's title or from the message body
    33â†’* The recruiter's name
    34â†’* If it is a contract or a Full Time position from the message body
    35â†’* The date and time of the message, if it is only a day of the week or a hours ago calculate the datetime it was received.
    36â†’  Note that it is always presented in the -07:00 timezone, unless explicitly stated otherwise.
    37â†’* Subject of the message (if available)
    38â†’* The message body
    39â†’
    40â†’#### Input format
    41â†’
    42â†’Below are texts written in mixed of regex and text., like a regex using python's f-string format for variables.
    43â†’If multiple messages arrived, they are separated by a triple dash `\n---\n`.
    44â†’It comes in one of the following formats:
    45â†’
    46â†’##### Format 1 - LinkedIn
    47â†’
    48â†’* Note that, sometimes, the person includes their company in their title, like "Talent Partner@ Amazon Robotics".
    49â†’* In that case, you should extract the company name from the title.
    50â†’* Gender pronouns are optional
    51â†’* "\nVerified recruiter" is optional
    52â†’* ", #HIRING" is optional
    53â†’* "\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+" is optional
    54â†’* "{{subject}}\n" is optional
    55â†’* "\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload" is optional
    56â†’* You should infer the desired variables from the text.
    57â†’
    58â†’```text
    59â†’{{full_name}}(\n\({{gender_pronouns}}\))?\n{{degree_connection}} degree connection\nÂ· {{degree_connection}}\n{{person_title}}\n(\nVerified recruiter)?\n{{day_of_week_or_date}}\n{{full_name}} sent the following messages at {{time}}\nView {{first_name}}â€™s profile{{full_name}}(, #HIRING)?\n{{full_name}}( \({{gender_pronouns}}\))?  {{time}}(\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+)?\n+({{subject}}\n)?{{message_body}}(\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload)?
    60â†’```
    61â†’
    62â†’##### Format 2 - Email
    63â†’
    64â†’* "{{labels_names}}" is optional
    65â†’* You should infer the desired variables from the text.
    66â†’
    67â†’```text
    68â†’{{subject}}\n({{labels_names}})?\n\n{{from}} <{{email_address}}>\n{{datetime_info}}\nto {{JoÃ£o}}\n\n{{message_body}}
    69â†’```
    70â†’
    71â†’### History File
    72â†’
    73â†’Create a new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.
    74â†’
    75â†’#### History File Filename
    76â†’
    77â†’The filename should be in the format of `<company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>.yaml` for full time positions
    78â†’or `<recruiting_company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>-<company_name>.yaml` for contract positions.
    79â†’
    80â†’If either the company name or the recruiting company name is unknown, use the word `unknown` in its place.
    81â†’
    82â†’#### History File Content
    83â†’
    84â†’The generated content should follow one of the templates below:
    85â†’
    86â†’##### Template Group 1 - LinkedIn
    87â†’
    88â†’* Note that `optional_subject` is optional
    89â†’* `timestamp` should be printed in ISO format with the day of the week after it, e.g., `2025-08-20T15:21:00-07:00 Wednesday`
    90â†’* Datetimes are always in -07:00 timezone
    91â†’
    92â†’###### Template Group 1.1 - Reach-Out for contract positions
    93â†’
    94â†’####### Template 1.1.1 - Without company name
    95â†’
    96â†’```yaml
    97â†’context:
    98â†’  - Approaches with no company name usually seems fishy to me, but I'm ok with that.
    99â†’  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
   100â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   101â†’platform: linkedin
   102â†’process_status: recruiter reach-out
   103â†’conversation_history:
   104â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
   105â†’    from: {{from}}
   106â†’    subject: {{optional_subject}}
   107â†’    body: |
   108â†’      {{message_body}}
   109â†’```
   110â†’
   111â†’###### Template 1.1.2 - With company name
   112â†’
   113â†’```yaml
   114â†’context:
   115â†’  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
   116â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   117â†’platform: linkedin
   118â†’process_status: recruiter reach-out
   119â†’conversation_history:
   120â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
   121â†’    from: {{from}}
   122â†’    subject: {{optional_subject}}
   123â†’    body: |
   124â†’      {{message_body}}
   125â†’```
   126â†’
   127â†’###### Template Group 1.2 - Reach-out for Full Time positions
   128â†’
   129â†’####### Template 1.2.1 - Without company name
   130â†’
   131â†’```yaml
   132â†’context:
   133â†’  - Approaches with no company name usually seems fishy to me, but I'm ok with that.
   134â†’  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
   135â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   136â†’platform: linkedin
   137â†’process_status: recruiter reach-out

   139â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}

   141â†’    subject: {{optional_subject}}
   142â†’    body: |
   143â†’      {{message_body}}
   144â†’```
   145â†’
   146â†’####### Template 1.2.2 - With company name
   147â†’
   148â†’```yaml
   149â†’context:
   150â†’  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
   151â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   152â†’platform: linkedin
   153â†’process_status: recruiter reach-out
   154â†’conversation_history:
   155â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
   156â†’    from: {{from}}
   157â†’    subject: {{optional_subject}}
   158â†’    body: |
   159â†’      {{message_body}}
   160â†’```
   161â†’
   162â†’###### Template Group 1.3 - Response to LinkedIn Applications
   163â†’
   164â†’####### Template 1.3.1 - Response to LinkedIn Application
   165â†’
   166â†’```yaml
   167â†’context:
   168â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   169â†’platform: linkedin
   170â†’process_status: application response
   171â†’conversation_history:
   172â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
   173â†’    from: {{from}}
   174â†’    subject: {{subject}}
   175â†’    body: |
   176â†’      {{message_body}}
   177â†’```
   178â†’
   179â†’##### Template Group 2 - Email
   180â†’
   181â†’###### Template 2.1 - Recruiter Reach-Out for contract positions
   182â†’
   183â†’```yaml
   184â†’context:
   185â†’  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
   186â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   187â†’platform: email
   188â†’process_status: recruiter reach-out
   189â†’conversation_history:
   190â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
   191â†’    from: {{from}}

   214â†’
   215â†’####### Template 3.1 - Response to Email Application
   216â†’
   217â†’```yaml
   218â†’context:
   219â†’  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
   220â†’platform: email

   223â†’  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}

file.content:
---
description: Create a new history and input file in the @job-hunting/history and @job-hunting/input directories.
argument-hint: Raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin
allowed-tools: Task, Read, TodoWrite, Write, LS, Grep, Glob, Edit
---

## Context

Arguments: $ARGUMENTS
Arguments is a raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin

## Task

Your task is to create 2 files:

* A new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.
* A new input file in the @job-hunting/input directory.

### Steps

1. Parse the arguments to extract the desired information
2. analyze the arguments to determine the best template to use
3. analyze the arguments to extract non-obvious information, like the datetime of the message and company name
4. Create the history file
5. Create the input file

### Arguments Parsing

You should parse the arguments to extract the following information:

* The company name, either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiting company name (for contract positions), either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiter's name
* If it is a contract or a Full Time position from the message body
* The date and time of the message, if it is only a day of the week or a hours ago calculate the datetime it was received.
  Note that it is always presented in the -07:00 timezone, unless explicitly stated otherwise.
* Subject of the message (if available)
* The message body

#### Input format

Below are texts written in mixed of regex and text., like a regex using python's f-string format for variables.
If multiple messages arrived, they are separated by a triple dash `\n---\n`.
It comes in one of the following formats:

##### Format 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that, sometimes, the person includes their company in their title, like "Talent Partner@ Amazon Robotics".
* In that case, you should extract the company name from the title.
* Gender pronouns are optional
* "\nVerified recruiter" is optional
* ", #HIRING" is optional
* "\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+" is optional
* "{{subject}}\n" is optional
* "\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{full_name}}(\n\({{gender_pronouns}}\))?\n{{degree_connection}} degree connection\nÂ· {{degree_connection}}\n{{person_title}}\n(\nVerified recruiter)?\n{{day_of_week_or_date}}\n{{full_name}} sent the following messages at {{time}}\nView {{first_name}}â€™s profile{{full_name}}(, #HIRING)?\n{{full_name}}( \({{gender_pronouns}}\))?  {{time}}(\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+)?\n+({{subject}}\n)?{{message_body}}(\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload)?
```

##### Format 2 - Email

* "{{labels_names}}" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{subject}}\n({{labels_names}})?\n\n{{from}} <{{email_address}}>\n{{datetime_info}}\nto {{JoÃ£o}}\n\n{{message_body}}
```

### History File

Create a new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.

#### History File Filename

The filename should be in the format of `<company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>.yaml` for full time positions
or `<recruiting_company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>-<company_name>.yaml` for contract positions.

If either the company name or the recruiting company name is unknown, use the word `unknown` in its place.

#### History File Content

The generated content should follow one of the templates below:

##### Template Group 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that `optional_subject` is optional
* `timestamp` should be printed in ISO format with the day of the week after it, e.g., `2025-08-20T15:21:00-07:00 Wednesday`
* Datetimes are always in -07:00 timezone

###### Template Group 1.1 - Reach-Out for contract positions

####### Template 1.1.1 - Without company name

```yaml
context:
  - Approaches with no company name usually seems fishy to me, but I'm ok with that.
  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 1.1.2 - With company name

```yaml
context:
  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.2 - Reach-out for Full Time positions

####### Template 1.2.1 - Without company name

```yaml
context:
  - Approaches with no company name usually seems fishy to me, but I'm ok with that.
  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

####### Template 1.2.2 - With company name

```yaml
context:
  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.3 - Response to LinkedIn Applications

####### Template 1.3.1 - Response to LinkedIn Application

```yaml
context:
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: application response
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

##### Template Group 2 - Email

###### Template 2.1 - Recruiter Reach-Out for contract positions

```yaml
context:
  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: email
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.2 - Recruiter Reach-Out for full time positions

```yaml
context:
  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: email
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.3 - Application Response

####### Template 3.1 - Response to Email Application

```yaml
context:
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: email
process_status: application response
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

### Input File

Create a new input file in the @job-hunting/input directory.

#### Input File Filename

The same filename as the history file, it will be just in a different directory.

#### Input File Content

The generated content should follow the template below:

```yaml
resume_filepath: @job-hunting/resume.md
conversation_history_filepath: @job-hunting/history/{{filename}}.yaml
output_filepath: @job-hunting/history/{{filename}}.yaml
datetime_now:
```

\* Leave the `datetime_now` field empty.

    23â†’3. analyze the arguments to extract non-obvious information, like the datetime of the message and company name
    24â†’4. Create the history file
    25â†’5. Create the input file
    26â†’
    27â†’### Arguments Parsing
    28â†’
    29â†’You should parse the arguments to extract the following information:
    30â†’
    31â†’* The company name, either from the person's title or from the message body
    32â†’* The recruiting company name (for contract positions), either from the person's title or from the message body
    33â†’* The recruiter's name
    34â†’* If it is a contract or a Full Time position from the message body
    35â†’* The date and time of the message, if it is only a day of the week or a hours ago calculate the datetime it was received.
    36â†’  Note that it is always presented in the -07:00 timezone, unless explicitly stated otherwise.
    37â†’* Subject of the message (if available)
    38â†’* The message body
    39â†’
    40â†’#### Input format
    41â†’
    42â†’Below are texts written in mixed of regex and text., like a regex using python's f-string format for variables.
    43â†’If multiple messages arrived, they are separated by a triple dash `\n---\n`.
    44â†’It comes in one of the following formats:
    45â†’
    46â†’##### Format 1 - LinkedIn
    47â†’
    48â†’* Note that, sometimes, the person includes their company in their title, like "Talent Partner@ Amazon Robotics".
    49â†’* In that case, you should extract the company name from the title.
    50â†’* Gender pronouns are optional
    51â†’* "\nVerified recruiter" is optional
    52â†’* ", #HIRING" is optional
    53â†’* "\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+" is optional
    54â†’* "{{subject}}\n" is optional
    55â†’* "\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload" is optional
    56â†’* You should infer the desired variables from the text.
    57â†’
    58â†’```text
    59â†’{{full_name}}(\n\({{gender_pronouns}}\))?\n{{degree_connection}} degree connection\nÂ· {{degree_connection}}\n{{person_title}}\n(\nVerified recruiter)?\n{{day_of_week_or_date}}\n{{full_name}} sent the following messages at {{time}}\nView {{first_name}}â€™s profile{{full_name}}(, #HIRING)?\n{{full_name}}( \({{gender_pronouns}}\))?  {{time}}(\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+)?\n+({{subject}}\n)?{{message_body}}(\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload)?
    60â†’```
    61â†’
    62â†’##### Format 2 - Email
    63â†’
    64â†’* "{{labels_names}}" is optional
    65â†’* You should infer the desired variables from the text.
    66â†’
    67â†’```text
    68â†’{{subject}}\n({{labels_names}})?\n\n{{from}} <{{email_address}}>\n{{datetime_info}}\nto {{JoÃ£o}}\n\n{{message_body}}
    69â†’```
    70â†’
    71â†’### History File
    72â†’
    73â†’Create a new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.

    77â†’The filename should be in the format of `<company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>.yaml` for full time positions
    78â†’or `<recruiting_company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>-<company_name>.yaml` for contract positions.
    79â†’
    80â†’If either the company name or the recruiting company name is unknown, use the word `unknown` in its place.
    81â†’

    88â†’* Note that `optional_subject` is optional
    89â†’* `timestamp` should be printed in ISO format with the day of the week after it, e.g., `2025-08-20T15:21:00-07:00 Wednesday`

    91â†’
    92â†’###### Template Group 1.1 - Reach-Out for contract positions

file.content:
---
description: Create a new history and input file in the @job-hunting/history and @job-hunting/input directories.
argument-hint: Raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin
allowed-tools: Task, Read, TodoWrite, Write, LS, Grep, Glob, Edit
---

## Context

Arguments: $ARGUMENTS
Arguments is a raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin

## Task

Your task is to create 2 files:

* A new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.
* A new input file in the @job-hunting/input directory.

### Steps

1. Parse the arguments to extract the desired information
2. analyze the arguments to determine the best template to use
3. analyze the arguments to extract non-obvious information, like the datetime of the message and company name
4. Create the history file
5. Create the input file

### Arguments Parsing

You should parse the arguments to extract the following information:

* The company name, either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiting company name (for contract positions), either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiter's name
* If it is a contract or a Full Time position from the message body
* The date and time of the message, if it is only a day of the week or a hours ago calculate the datetime it was received.
  Note that it is always presented in the -07:00 timezone, unless explicitly stated otherwise.
* Subject of the message (if available)
* The message body

#### Input format

Below are texts written in mixed of regex and text., like a regex using python's f-string format for variables.
If multiple messages arrived, they are separated by a triple dash `\n---\n`.
It comes in one of the following formats:

##### Format 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that, sometimes, the person includes their company in their title, like "Talent Partner@ Amazon Robotics".
* In that case, you should extract the company name from the title.
* Gender pronouns are optional
* "\nVerified recruiter" is optional
* ", #HIRING" is optional
* "\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+" is optional
* "{{subject}}\n" is optional
* "\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{full_name}}(\n\({{gender_pronouns}}\))?\n{{degree_connection}} degree connection\nÂ· {{degree_connection}}\n{{person_title}}\n(\nVerified recruiter)?\n{{day_of_week_or_date}}\n{{full_name}} sent the following messages at {{time}}\nView {{first_name}}â€™s profile{{full_name}}(, #HIRING)?\n{{full_name}}( \({{gender_pronouns}}\))?  {{time}}(\nğŸ‘\nğŸ‘\nğŸ˜Š\n+)?\n+({{subject}}\n)?{{message_body}}(\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload)?
```

##### Format 2 - Email

* "{{labels_names}}" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{subject}}\n({{labels_names}})?\n\n{{from}} <{{email_address}}>\n{{datetime_info}}\nto {{JoÃ£o}}\n\n{{message_body}}
```

### History File

Create a new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.

#### History File Filename

The filename should be in the format of `<company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>.yaml` for full time positions
or `<recruiting_company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>-<company_name>.yaml` for contract positions.

If either the company name or the recruiting company name is unknown, use the word `unknown` in its place.

#### History File Content

The generated content should follow one of the templates below:

##### Template Group 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that `optional_subject` is optional
* `timestamp` should be printed in ISO format with the day of the week after it, e.g., `2025-08-20T15:21:00-07:00 Wednesday`
* Datetimes are always in -07:00 timezone

###### Template Group 1.1 - Reach-Out for contract positions

####### Template 1.1.1 - Without company name

```yaml
context:
  - Approaches with no company name usually seems fishy to me, but I'm ok with that.
  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 1.1.2 - With company name

```yaml
context:
  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.2 - Reach-out for Full Time positions

####### Template 1.2.1 - Without company name

```yaml
context:
  - Approaches with no company name usually seems fishy to me, but I'm ok with that.
  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

####### Template 1.2.2 - With company name

```yaml
context:
  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.3 - Response to LinkedIn Applications

####### Template 1.3.1 - Response to LinkedIn Application

```yaml
context:
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: linkedin
process_status: application response
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

##### Template Group 2 - Email

###### Template 2.1 - Recruiter Reach-Out for contract positions

```yaml
context:
  - 70/hour is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: email
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.2 - Recruiter Reach-Out for full time positions

```yaml
context:
  - 140k yearly is in the lower range of my acceptable range, but it is still inside. Below that I must reject. The higher the better.
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: email
process_status: recruiter reach-out
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.3 - Application Response

####### Template 3.1 - Response to Email Application

```yaml
context:
  - Do not forget to mention that I require H1B Visa Sponsorship for any new position.
platform: email
process_status: application response
conversation_history:
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

### Input File

Create a new input file in the @job-hunting/input directory.

#### Input File Filename

The same filename as the history file, it will be just in a different directory.

#### Input File Content

The generated content should follow the template below:

```yaml
resume_filepath: @job-hunting/resume.md
conversation_history_filepath: @job-hunting/history/{{filename}}.yaml
output_filepath: @job-hunting/history/{{filename}}.yaml
datetime_now:
```

\* Leave the `datetime_now` field empty.

Perfect! Now let me parse the provided arguments to extract the necessary information:

**Arguments Analysis:**
- **Platform**: Email (based on email format)
- **Company Name**: Grupo QuintoAndar 
- **Recruiter Name**: Clara Marques Dos Santos (first name: Clara)
- **Position Type**: Full Time (Staff Software Engineer)
- **Subject**: "Tech Screening | ConfirmaÃ§Ã£o de Entrevista - Grupo QuintoAndar | Staff Software Engineer"
- **Date/Time**: "Wed, Sep 17, 10:50 AM (13 hours ago)" - This translates to approximately September 17, 2025, 10:50 AM. Since the email mentions GMT-3 timezone and considering it's currently Sep 18, this would be 2025-09-17T10:50:00-03:00
- **Process Status**: This appears to be an "application response" since it's confirming an interview for a position already applied to
- **Email Address**: clara.santos@quintoandar.com.br

**Template Selection**: Template 2.3 (Template 3.1 - Response to Email Application) since this is an email response to an application.

**Filename**: `quintoandar-clara.yaml` (company name + recruiter first name)

Now let me create both files:

I used Template 2.3 (Response to Email Application) since this is an email response confirming an interview for a previously submitted application. The system has also automatically detected that this is part of an ongoing process and added a reference to the related file `quintoandar-rebeca.yaml` in the context, plus included an additional message from Clara about the tech screening preparation.
